column4: wow...almost did it... almost switched back to Windows... - what was I thinking!!
time lapse to install Windows XP sp3 from sp1 CD with all apps - ~5 hours
time lapse to install Ubuntu Jaunty with all apps - < 1 hour
right
time lapse to install archlinux with all apps you want - < 30 min :) j/k not here to advertise, just wanna help
assuming you go with minimal desktop of course
I went with enhanced desktop and took a little less than an hour to install
enhanced desktop. for ubuntu i assume that means gnome + compiz
right, exactly plus I had to roll back my intel driver so that it could handle it..
ah. is ubuntu not using fusion plugins yet?
not sure
can't get it to work with my Geforce 6200 Nvidia card
which nvidia drivers btw? 185.18.14 is running nice with my 8600
again, not sure
I need to do some more research, but Its' working great on my onboard intel 865G video driver
really? i've heard all kinds of horror stories about intel drivers. particularly framebuffer graphics issues and artifacts while gaming
it took me some heavy research but I found a solution that works.. you have to rollback the driver to a previous version
I thought for sure my Geforce 6200 would work but no joy
Ubuntu won't even boot
really? worst i ever got was a crashing x session. i could always get to run level 3 though
then again, doesn't ubuntu start init 5 and gdm by default anyways?
Ubuntu starts to boot up , gets about 1/4 way through start up and hangs... screen turns black.. nothing
